Create a heatmap of BirdNET detections by hour and date

Source: R/birdnet_heatmap.R
birdnet_heatmap.Rd

This function generates a heatmap showing the daily activity pattern of a specified species detected in BirdNET output data. The function optionally filters detections by a confidence threshold and displays activity levels (number of detections) across time.

Usage

birdnet_heatmap(
  data,
  species = NULL,
  threshold = NULL,
  min_date = NULL,
  max_date = NULL,
  hour = NULL
)

Arguments

data

A data frame containing BirdNET output. Must include columns with time and species information. Column names will be standardized internally using birdnet_clean_names().

species

Character. The common name of the species to visualize.

threshold

Numeric or NULL. Optional confidence threshold (0–1) used to filter detections. If NULL, no threshold filtering is applied.

min_date

Character or NULL. The minimum date to include in the heatmap. If NULL, the earliest date will be used.

max_date

Character or NULL. The maximum date to include in the heatmap. If NULL, the latest date will be used.

hour

Integer vector between 0 and 23 specifying which hours of the day to keep (e.g., c(4:7)).

Value

A ggplot heatmap showing the number of detections by hour and date.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
birdnet_heatmap(data = birdnet_output, species = "Swainson's Thrush", threshold = 0.7)
} # }
